channel.title: Sennheiser
channel.description:
I am looking into buying a new headset for use with my computer, after asking around for a bit most people suggested I get the PX 200's by Sennheiser, or the PX 100.
There aren't many differences between the 2 but the main one I found was the PX 200's have a back casing on the cup so the music(Or whatever you're listening to) will be louder at a higher volume through the PX 200's than that of the PX 100's. The 200's are also only an extra £5.
Has anyone had any experience with the PX 100's or the PX 200's here ?
PX 200's: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Sennheiser-PX200-Black-Closed-Headphone/dp/B000089GN4/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=electronics&qid=1252959250&sr=8-1
PX 100's: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Sennheiser-PX-100-PX100-Headphones/dp/B00009QH7P/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=electronics&qid=1252960000&sr=1-1

item.title: Sennheiser
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Get the PX 200’s, I’ve had both (Admittedly they’re not my favourite headsets) and I thought the sound quality was a LOT better. You can really tell the difference in my opinion for a little bit extra of a price.

You know, you could just get a set of Turtle Beach X1’s as they can be used with your console and computer, while being used as a microphone aswell? I think Amazon list them at £40-45 though so it’s really upto you.

Read full topic

item.title: Sennheiser
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Touch outta my price range though, was looking for £20 - £40 max.

Read full topic
